page.title: 13WINDMILLS
page.content: An outstanding feature on the skyline of the South Downs are the windmills called "Jack and Jill". We interviewed a member of the Windmill Society who gave us much interesting information. Jill was reputedly built in Brighton in 1821 and moved by a team of 8O oxen in one piece to its present position alongside Jack in 1852. The society is restoring Jill as a working example. Each Saturday a group of voluntary workers restore the mill as exactly as possible to the original plan. Interesting graffiti have been found such as the names of 4 workers who all decided to join the army in 1917. Another comment hidden behind a timber shows that the centre pole was replaced in 1852.
